title: 1980s Australian TV miniature
credit_line: Designed by Graham McGuffie, Emily Boutard and Megafun
brief_description: This gorgeous miniature model celebrates the evolving design of rooms where Australians watch TV, as well as the most memorable shows from the 1980s.

constellations_primary.name: Australian TV in the 1980s
constellations_primary.description: Australian television in the 80s really began to find its footing with mainstream hits becoming landmarks of the industry.

description: Neighbours, everybody needs good neighbours. But it didn’t start out that way, with the now iconic Australian soap first debuting to low ratings on Channel 7 in 1985. Following its cancellation, Channel 10 snapped up the rights and took a more a youthful approach with new cast members Jason Donovan, Guy Pearce and Kylie Minogue. Neighbours creator Reg Watson had another hit with Sons and Daughters, which was modelled off prime-time soaps in the US. One of Australia’s first reality programs, Perfect Match, also debuted in 1984, featuring dating-show robot Dexter who mathematically matched contestants with a compatibility score.
